question: What two-word type of model did Manash Pratim Kashyap's and PS Fader's studies in customer retention studies published during 2018-2019 have in common (no punctuation)?

trajectory.question: What two-word type of model did Manash Pratim Kashyap's and PS Fader's studies in customer retention studies published during 2018-2019 have in common (no punctuation)?

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to quickly find the specific 2018-2019 customer retention papers by Manash Pratim Kashyap and Peter S Fader and identify the shared model type.

args.query: Manash Pratim Kashyap customer retention 2018 2019 model paper
Manash Pratim Kashyap PS Fader customer retention 2018 2019 model

1. a simple model for analyzing the customer retention comparing rural ...

2. A Simple Model For Analyzing The Customer Retention Comparing ...
   URL: https://www.journalijar.com/article/26843/a-simple-model-for-analyzing-the-customer-retention-comparing-rural-and-urban-store/
   Site: journalijar.com
   Summary: The main goal of this paper is to predict future purchase patterns for rural and urban customer that can be described by the structural characteristics.

3. A Simple Model for Analyzing the Customer Retention Comparing ...

   Summary: The study analyzes customer retention using a discrete time beta geometric model on 390 households. Retention rates show 75% for rural customers and 55.37% for ...

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to verify which model type Peter S Fader used in his 2018-2019 customer retention work to confirm the common two-word model.

args.query: Peter S. Fader 2018 2019 customer retention beta geometric model
Manash Pratim Kashyap beta geometric model customer retention 2019

tool_executed.name: web_search
tool_executed.result:
Found 3 relevant web results:

1. [PDF] “How to Project Customer Retention” Revisited - Bruce Hardie's
   URL: https://brucehardie.com/papers/037/BdW_JIM_2018-01-10_rev.pdf
   Site: brucehardie.com
   Summary: Fader and Hardie (2007), hereafter FH, presented the beta-geometric (BG) distribution as a simple probability model for projecting customer retention. This ...

2. “How to Project Customer Retention” Revisited: The Role of ...
   URL: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S1094996818300057
   Site: sciencedirect.com
   Summary: Fader and Hardie (2007), hereafter FH, presented the beta-geometric (BG) distribution as a simple probability model for projecting customer retention. This ...

3. [PDF] How to project customer retention - Wharton Faculty Platform
   URL: https://faculty.wharton.upenn.edu/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/Fader_hardie_jim_07.pdf
   Site: faculty.wharton.upenn.edu
   Summary: We show that our basic model (known as a “shifted-beta-geometric”) can be implemented in a simple Microsoft Excel spreadsheet and provides remarkably accurate.

trajectory.actor_reasoning:
Both studies reference the beta geometric family: Kashyap’s paper uses a discrete time beta geometric model, and Fader’s work discusses the beta geometric distribution; the shared two-word model type is beta geometric.

FINAL ANSWER: beta geometric
